description: A whimsical, animated porcelain teacup with a handle that mimics a mouth. The Chattering Teacup hops around on its delicate base, making clinking sounds as it moves. Despite its small size, it has a mischievous personality and is known for its incessant chattering and attempts to cause mild chaos.
damage_resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
lair_type: Abandoned Tea Parlors or Forgotten Corners of Magical Estates

traits.name: Magical Mimicry
traits.description: The Chattering Teacup can mimic any sound it has heard within the last 24 hours, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

traits.name: Innocuous Appearance
traits.description: Due to its harmless appearance, the Chattering Teacup has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

actions.name: Chattering Distraction
actions.description: The Chattering Teacup chatters loudly, distracting a creature within 30 feet that can hear it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Hop and Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.
